page.title: 03ST.MARY'S CHURCH CAPEL
page.content: St.Mary's church was begun in the early 12th century. The porch was added in the 14th century. At that time the original chancel arch was removed and the present, unique, rood screen of three arches, with one above to accommodate the rood loft, was built.One Norman window with a fresco painting has survived and a triangular window, put in to light the rood loft. When the village 'moved' to either side of the A20,St. Radigund's church was built in the centre of the village. Today St. Mary's is only used for weddings, baptisms and funerals and is soon to be taken over by the Redundant Churches Fund. This means that although it will no longer be used as a church, it will be cared for and maintained and the rood screen and other unusual features will be saved.
